# Convergence

## Cauchy criterion

Following are useful for determining convergence.


::: {.proposition #cauchy name=""}

Sequence $(x_n)$ converges iff
$$
\lim_{m,n \to \infty} |x_m-x_n|=0
$$

:::


::: {.proposition  name=""}

IF there exists a positive sequence $(\epsilon_n)$ s.t.
$$
\sum_{n}^{} \epsilon_n <\infty
$$

:::
